txt.en: 'Come, let us return to Hlithseld.'
'The steed Haldend chose kicked him in the head, cracking his skull.'
Talk to Léothred at Hlithseld
Framsburg can be found in Misthallow.\n\nYou should learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred.
'We learned quite a lot upon our first day at Framsburg. I do say, we shall learn even more tomorrow!'
Explore Framsburg
Learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred
Framsburg can be found in Misthallow.\n\nYou should learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred.
Learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred
Learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred

'I have learned much from our time in Misthallow thus far, [placeholder]. Now comes the time to make the trek to the great keep of my people's past. It is a relic and a keeper of memories both. There we will most certainly uncover many a hidden secret, and reaffirm many of the stories of old. Come, let us travel and establish a safe encampment near Framsburg. I would imagine that we will stay there to study the keep for quite some time.'
Learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred
Framsburg can be found in Misthallow.\n\nYou should learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred.
Learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred

'With the Éothéod’s aid, the Longbeards once again drove the last Orcs back to Gundabad. Théodric would not break his namesake Thíudric’s ban upon entering the Mountain-home though. His reluctance played a part in King Glóin’s decision not to enter Gundabad either.'

'Lord Théodric was in turn succeeded by his son Haldend, a grim and rude-mannered man who urged his father to break the Ban of Thíudric and enter Gundabad. He yearned for the glory he had found fighting the Orcs, and at the age of fifty, only two years into his reign, he foolishly chose to attempt to ride a mearh.'
Gundric

'Haldend was no more fortunate than Gundric and Gisilhári. The steed he chose kicked him in the head, cracking his skull. He survived, but the wound robbed him of his wits, leaving him unable to speak more than a few words or lift a sword.'
Hlithseld is located in the north of Misthallow.\n\nYou should talk to Léothred at Hlithseld.
Haldend
'Now comes the time to make the trek to the great keep of my people's past. '

'We learned quite a lot upon our first day at Framsburg. I do say, we shall learn even more tomorrow! Until then I will write down my findings and get some well-deserved rest. I suggest you do the same.'
'This encampment will do nicely.'
'It was Lóthar’s son, Gundric, who brought the most grief to his father’s rule.'
'Lóthar took in his one-year-old grandson, Bóra, and raised him as his own.'
'During Bóra's rule, King Thorin I of the Longbeards was slain by Orcs.'
'With the Éothéod’s aid, the Longbeards once again drove the last Orcs back to Gundabad.'
'Lord Théodric was succeeded by his son Haldend, a grim and rude-mannered man.'
Léothred, the Rohirric scholar, seeks to travel to the great fortress that his people built in Misthallow.
Lóthar
Hlithseld has been established!
Establish an encampment in Misthallow near Framsburg
Travel to Hlithseld to rest
This rocky promontory is blanketed with old ruins
Learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred
Bóra
Talk to Léothred at Hlithseld
Éothéod
Hlithseld is located in the north of Misthallow.\n\nYou should establish the camp of Hlithseld with Léothred.
Talk to Léothred elsewhere in Framsburg
Talk to Léothred elsewhere in Framsburg
Hlithseld is located in the north of Misthallow.\n\nYou should travel to Hlithseld and rest.
Théodric
Talk to Léothred elsewhere in Framsburg

'At last, we reach Framsburg! Now where to begin? Ah yes, Lóthar.\n\n'Now it was Lóthar’s son Gundric who brought the most grief to his father’s rule, for he dared seek to ride one of the mearas. Like his longfather Gisilhári he failed, perishing beneath the angry hooves when the beast trampled him.'
Talk to Léothred elsewhere in Framsburg

'Grieving, Lóthar took in his one-year-old grandson, Bóra, and raised him as his own. During this time, a change befell the Ai-thúda. Due to close contact with both the dwarves and the Hól-budlan, their language underwent a series of changes, so that by the end of Lord Lóthar’s rule, it mostly resembled the later tongue of my people.\n\n'Framabárg became Framsburg in their language; Hól-budla became holbytla, and their own name of Ai-thúda now was spoken as Éothéod. It also became tradition, after the fashion of Frumgar long ago, for the lords to name their heirs with words that meant lord or some variant thereof.'
Léothred can be found in Framsburg.\n\nYou should talk to Léothred in Framsburg.
Talk to Léothred elsewhere in Framsburg

'Lóthar’s grandson Bóra succeeded him, and during Bóra's rule, King Thorin I of the Longbeards was slain by Orcs in Ered Mithrin. This sparked the Fifth War of Dwarves and Orcs. The Éothéod found themselves pulled into the fighting that raged in the mountains around them, for the Orcs threatened them as well. This unrest lasted through Bóra’s rule and that of his son Maera, ending at last in the time of Théodric, Maera’s son.'
Léothred can be found in Framsburg.\n\nYou should talk to Léothred in Framsburg.
Talk to Léothred in Framsburg

Framsburg can be found in Misthallow.\n\nYou should learn the history of the Rohirrim with Léothred.

'This encampment will do nicely. I thank you for your help. Framsburg is but a bridge away, not far at all!

'Yes, I did call this keep Fasthálla earlier. I do apologize. The keep was renamed Framsburg after the great Fram!

'Now then, should we begin studying the ruins?'
Hlithseld is located in the north of Misthallow.\n\nYou should talk to Léothred at Hlithseld.
'My grandson. My Bóra. You are all I have now.'
'I come bearing grave tidings. King Thorin has been slain by Orcs.'
'A time of hardship will be upon us. We must prepare ourselves.'
Legacy in the Mist
'Thíudric's words ring true, even now. We will not enter Gundabad.'
'You are a fool father! There are riches and glory to be had in Gundabad!'
Framsburg can be found in the north of Misthallow.\n\nYou should explore Framsburg.
'Aargh!'
